articles.author: Nandita Bose, Joseph Ax, Steve Holland
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden was set to address the nation on Thursday after a stinging election defeat for his Democratic Party at the hands of Republican Donald Trump, whose stunning political comeback has reverberated around the world.
articles.title: Biden set to address nation after Trump's decisive U.S. election win

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces stepped up bombardment across the Gaza Strip and ordered more evacuations, creating a fresh wave of displacement.
articles.title: More families stream out of north Gaza, as tanks push deeper

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: German Economy Minister Robert Habeck said on Thursday that Chancellor Olaf Scholz was right to fire the finance minister, spelling an end to the coalition government, and insisted that Germany was still capable of functioning.
articles.title: Germany still capable of functioning, economy minister says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Mozambican police fired tear gas at hundreds of opposition supporters converging on the capital Maputo on Thursday for the biggest demonstration yet against last month's disputed election.
articles.title: Mozambique police fire tear gas as opposition supporters march on capital

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Russian guided bomb attack on Ukraine's southeastern city of Zaporizhzhia on Thursday killed four people and wounded 18, destroying houses and damaging an oncology centre, officials said.
articles.title: Russian attack on Ukraine's Zaporizhzhia damages oncology ward, kills four

articles.author: Daniel Becerril, Lizbeth Diaz
articles.description: Thousands of migrants traveling together in a caravan in Mexico are grappling with their next steps after former U.S. President Donald Trump, who ran on an anti-immigration platform, was propelled to victory for a second term.
articles.title: Trump win casts doubt on future of Mexico's migrant caravan

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An Israeli strike on the southern Lebanese city of Sidon killed three Lebanese citizens and wounded three Lebanese soldiers and four Malaysian personnel from UNIFIL forces, the Lebanese army said on Thursday.
articles.title: Israeli strike in Lebanon's Sidon kills three citizens, Lebanese army says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Thai Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra met Myanmar's junta chief on the sidelines of a regional summit in China on Thursday, in a rare overseas trip by a general grappling with a civil war at home.
articles.title: Thai PM meets Myanmar junta chief on sidelines of summit in China

articles.author: Anthony Boadle
articles.description: Donald Trump's electoral victory in the United States has injected new energy into Brazil's hard right and stirred hopes that former President Jair Bolsonaro can mirror his return to power despite legal obstacles to running for office in 2026.
articles.title: Trump victory a boost for Brazil's right-wing politics

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least 73 people have died of mysterious causes in the Sudanese town of al-Hilaliya, besieged by the paramilitary Rapid Support Forces, the Sudanese Doctors Union said late on Wednesday.
articles.title: Dozens die of mysterious illness in besieged Sudan town
